WorkItem.Description:
Hello,

I set an update as prerequisite for another update. To be exactly I set NET.Framework as prerequisite for paint.net, mainly for testing purposes.

Unfortunately the NET.Framework update had a small bug. The package installed correctly and NET.Framework also worked. But in Windows Update the Update was displayed in some cases as failed. So I wanted to fix this issue what meaned that I had to create the update new from the beginning.

I removed the prerequisite setting in the paint.net update. But i still could not delete the NET.Framework update. WPP stated that the NET.Framework package is still added as prerequisite in another package.

When I tried to display that particular package WPP showed me only an emtpy list. I also verified that the paint.net package has not set any prerequisite.

To fix this I firstly had to delete the paint.net package. Afterwards it was possible to delete the NET.Framework package and create it new.


Greetings

willy
WorkItem.Summary: Error when setting an update as prerequisite for another update
